reviewText:
It's as bad as Jim Sterling said it was. The Jimquisition: The Slaughtering Grounds – A Steam Meltdown Saga[www.thejimquisition.com]

The framerate drops significantly the moment you look at anything, your system essentially hard-locks whenever there's any kind of loading, and I can't even MOVE because assigning the movement commands to the arrow keys doesn't work at all. Oh sure, the config program will let you do so just fine, as it's a Unity standard, but.. the game itself doesn't acknowledge the button presses! What the hell?!

Plus all the stuff covered in the video above, concerning both the game itself, and it's developer. I'm not sure if this game is the worst title on Steam, but it's certainly in the bottom ten. Avoid at all costs.

reviewText:
This game is garbage, nothing more. It is the worst gaming experience I had in a long time. The game just isn't done very well. It has ugly graphics and looks like it was made 10-15 years ago - by a 12-year-old. The gameplay is so uninspired and boring, it's almost impressive. Almost... All you do is collect ammo and shoot zombies. The zombie AI is bad. All a zombie has to do is follow you. A simple path-finding algorithm. Slaughtering Grounds fails to do even that sometimes (zombies sometimes just don't move). The gunplay is absolutely no fun. The guns don't feel very good. You don't feel a kick or something. If a game offers only so little gameplay, this gameplay better be good. In this case, it isn't.

Aside from that the game is buggy and has horrible performance. I have a quite powerful machine and can't run this game at a playable framerate. There are obviously significant memory leaks. When a map is loaded, i get the full 60 fps. But that lasts only for a few seconds. The framerate drops rapidly, until it reached like 15 fps. 15 fps is just completely unplayable. There are also other problems (like the menu, which doesn't work correctly - e.g. I can't exit the game; after clicking that everything just freezes).

I posted my opinion in the game's forum here on Steam. I was perma-banned pretty fast. I didn't use bad language or something. I just wrote how i feel about my experience" with the game. I also mentioned that the dev's have a habit of deleting threads and banning people - which they both did.

Well
date: to sum this up: the game is incredibly bad and the dev's should be ashamed for the behaviour they have shown in the last months. So would i recommend it? Hell

reviewText:
The good:  Character upgrade system (very weak), Multiplayer exists (but deserted)
The bad: Objectives are generic and time based with no penalty for failure, levelling system is very limited, ammo is minimal and you'll end up running around lookign for it, game is buggy, animation quality is abysmal, music is a 40 second endless loop.  Pathetic effort given the power of the Unity engine.
This game should not cost money, nor should it be on Steam.

Edit: Further investigation reveals apparently there are four stages and air drops.  I've still crapped turds with more polish than this.  Buy Killing Floor instead.

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds was a rather interesting game to play. It is also a game that has gained much notoriety because of the Devs, but we will set this aside and focus entirely on the game.

GameplayIn a game without any sort of story or extra game modes (aside from multiplayer which is pretty much just single player with more people, assuming you find someone to play with), gameplay is, and should be the strongest point of this game, but comes out being a bit lacking in this department. The game encloses you into an arena like map which lasts an allocated amount of time, which is around 20 minutes, then the map switches. The maps all seem to look the same once you play 2, where the only notable difference is that one is daytime and the other is nighttime. There is no way to win, unless time runs out, there a new “map” is loaded. There is an objective panel in the top left of your screen that never changes, even if you complete the objectives there, you just keep repeating them. Should you fail to complete an objective, you will hear “try again” and the timer will reset for that objective. The only thing completing objectives seems to do is spawn a “boss” which looks hilarious because of the way it runs at you, but the only notable difference is how much more ridiculous of these bosses look, because they die with very little effort. If you do kill a boss, money will be dropped, which stays on the ground for about a minute, and since the normal zombies seldom sense you, you are pretty much free to walk in circles in the money to continue collecting it. The zombies that are spawned throughout the map just stare and wait for a player to come near enough to be seen by the terrible AI. The AI is so horrible you can stand a few feet from a zombie and it many cases, it won’t attack unless you are practically touching it. There is also no accuracy loss for shooting the gun unzoomed, as compared to zoomed in, nor for shooting while sprinting. If you do happen to die, there is no penalty, making the death a bit for show, even if it’s an unimpressive death.  You will likely be only using the starting character and his shotgun, since it’s a 1 shot kill in most cases, and it’s pretty much pointless to unlock anything else since there is no incentive, nor benefit. You will also only gain ammo for the gun currently being held, for who knows that reason. The power-ups can be mistakenly shot, because they make an invisible wall when not picked up.  Thankfully though, there is now some small indication you are being attacked from behind, which is a blood splatter on screen, but can become rather tedious since it is not an immediate warning and lasts until death, or completely full heath. Thus making it rather pointless and distracting, since it’s always on screen and you cannot tell if the stain is from the last time you were attacked or if you are currently being attacked.

Audio/AestheticsThere is this infernal drum beat that keeps repeating, that will get stuck in your head after 10 minutes, not because its catchy and nice, but because it’s repetitive, annoying, and louder than most of the sound effects. The game and its assets all look horrible, and do not match, plus they are literally just slapped on and not even made to look like they belong to the same game. You will see zombies in tuxedos, prisoner zombies, weird ghoul zombies…you get the point, unless we’re doing a James Bond Jail thing here, I don’t see how they all go together. Many of the props are lazily put together, since you can shoot and jump through windows without them shattering. You can walk through trees and even through various other props such as tankers, though zombies cannot, which means you can stand there and do nothing whatsoever if you like. It is also not uncommon for you to just get stuck while sprinting up a staircase. Why? Well who knows, maybe your character is clumsy and gets his foot stuck, or gains weight while exercising, making him too wide to fit.

Verdict: 1.5/10

+.05 was given for making me laugh for the first 10 minutes, though it does get old for the remainder of the play through, if you can manage more than 15 minutes. I was going to include a section for glitches, but that would encompass most of the gameplay. Also, I did mention some gameplay in the audio/aesthetics to not make the gameplay too large, but it’s all part of the same category, since there is not very much to say about the audio or visuals.

If you enjoyed this review, or found it helpful, please feel free to follow our curator here.

Review:
So...Where do I begin?
Let's start with the graphics, they aren't good but I don't judge a game by it's a graphics so that won't effect this review however there are alot that will.

---Gameplay---
The games gameplay is all about killing mutants in a map filled with them similar to games such as killing floor however this game is not nearly as fun. You begin the game with loud music that you can only turn on and off although going to singleplayer or entering the Multiplayer servers (It's an entirely new menu with a new background) will cause the music to turn back on. When in the actual game you start with a shotgun with a starting ammo count of 8, yes 8 shells. The gun is extremely powerful but when you change to your revolver, guess what? 8 Bullets aswell, there are ammo crates scattered around but they are so few and only give you 8 bullets. The game controls nicely but I found alot of lag issues which could be my computer as it's not that powerful.

--Customisation--

You begin with 1 character and 2 weapons, in total their are 3 characters each with 2 guns, the characters cost 3k but I found it hard to actually get much money. You can upgrade your weapons for 1k. I think the most insulting thing ever is the menus for this, they don't function properly, how? Well you press right to go right and left to go...Right? Yes no matter which arrow you click it goes right/left, I would say the same about the weapons however you only have 2 per character so there's no way to know.

---Multiplayer---
I can't comment wholey on MP and how it works but from what I managed to do (by myself because no one was playing on the server) is that it is SP with people. There is a dedicated server which is good.

---Conclusion---

This game right now is not worth it, I do have hope that it will change in the future and improve but for now it lacks features. I give it a 4/10 for being a good idea but not well executed, hopefully they will add more maps, weapons and characters in the future.

---YouTube Video---
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qkzEUUJJofM

reviewText:
Slaughtering Grounds is very intense. So intense, that my computer refuses to play it at a solid framerate. It often crashes, but I assume that's an integral part of the game. The developers surely put in the time and effort to craft this masterpiece into what it is today. I dropped out of school to play this game 24/7. I no longer speak to my family, and I never leave my room. I keep a fridge close by stocked with Cheetos, Doritos, Fritos, and Mountain Dew. I've lost all my friends to this monolith of a game. I've gained 75 pounds since I first got this game.

Sometimes I look back at my life and realize all the opportunities that I could've had, all the friends I could have made, all the money I could have earned. But you know what? Those things are meaningless to me now. I've experienced pure bliss, and my heart can finally rest knowing I've enjoyed a masterpiece that very few people will ever uncover.

#NoRegrets

10/10

reviewText:
Right, The Slaughtering Ground;  this is a first-person shooter and was released on October 31st 2014. It is well known for its poor quality and infamous attack on Jim Sterling's video review of the game; however I am going to give it a break down as to why this game is as bad as it sounds.

The gameplay of Slaughtering Grounds is simple; you are dropped into a map and you have one aim; kill zombies. While this premise of an idea is not exactly rare these days on any game; some how Slaughtering Grounds manages to not even cover the basics. Lets start off with the gun play - there is zero amount of realism when it comes to how the guns work. When you try and aim down the iron-site, all that happens is the gun changes position and you just end up seeing the gun from a different angle. You start off with 10 bullets in your weapon; now that isn't a bad thing but as soon as you spawn you have to deal with at least 20 zombies before you can find your way to a ammo drop so you end up getting mobbed.

While we are on the topic of being mobbed...if you are being attacked from behind, the game gives no audible clues or easily noticeable visuals to warn you of this, apart from your small health bar. You can be happily (I use that term very loosely) walking around the map, unaware that you are actually being followed and stabbed in the back by a hoard of zombies and suddenly your camera angle is going 90° and you are dead.

Each stage has a number of different challenges which rewards money upon completing them. Kill a certain number of zombies, explode  zombies and get a varying amount of head-shots. Fair enough they add an extra depth to the gameplay but  to be honest, I found no way at all how you can explode zombies, and even if you are aiming directly at the head of an enemy, the game will not recognize you have shot it.

The graphics, oh god the graphics. These are some of the most diabolical graphics I have ever seen in a recent video game. It feels as if I am back in 1994 playing a release title on the PlayStation, and even then I am being generous. All of the models and textures have been stolen from other products and bare no new or creative input by the developers. The lighting effects on the first stage are laughably bad. You will get random light effects in side a building and then all of a sudden it will change completely and it'll be pitch black. Nothing makes sense....

As well as the above mentioned audio issues with being attacked by zombies, the horrible repeated Chinese style music that is repeated over, and over, and over and over and over....you get the point, gets extremely boring VERY fast. Each different level has no new music the same DUM DUM DUMDUMDUM in the background. I hated it!

The game is not hard though, once you get a hefty supply of shotgun ammo, nothing will kill you, apart from the game breaking bugs where you can get stuck in walls, fall through the floor, or just randomly drop dead for no apparent reason. When you do die, it seems you get no penalty either though, you just re spawn with the same amount of money, the same ammo and weapons, bonus I guess?  Apart from these bugs, the game is riddled with issues, I struggled to get even 30 fps on my rig, the game stutters and loads incredibly slowly, the only reason I can think of is because the game was coded by a room full of monkeys.

Slaughtering Grounds is currently on sale for 15p. Do I recommend it for 15p? You may as well put an extra few pennies aside and treat yourself to a Freddo. You will get more enjoyment out of the 10 seconds it takes to eat it than you will playing this game. I have spent one hour too many playing this game; but I thought it was only fair I played it for a substantial amount of time before casting my judgement; but please, do not give these disgusting developers any more money than they have some how already managed to generate.  This is the worst game I have ever played in 19 years of gaming.

If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group by clicking here.



http://store.steampowered.com/app/329950

reviewText:
So I decided to farm some cards, and realized I hadn't yet played this bargain bin reject. in the 50 minutes I endured this game, not only have I been impressed at the game-making skill equal to that of a toddler with half of its brain missing, but I'm downright amazed at how absolutely terrible and abysmal I felt.
This game lacks any sense of progress or purpose as I blindly ran around for 15 god forsaken minutes sprinting infinitely and getting headshots on trash-budget animated zombies when I wasn't even aiming at them, The health and ammo pickups were scattered across level one and I was stuck there for 15 minutes (or 16, I don't remember), trying to comprehend what my objective was. was it to survive? earn money? do the pointless objectives displayed in the top left? I couldn't work that out
there is one song, that sounds like it came from a chinese-knockoff shenmue game conducted by three pomeranians and a mute, for the menu and every single level, the song in question goes for about 30 seconds, then loops.
there is no negative to dying, which by the way is only indicated to you by a droning male voice and you won't even be aware of it because there is no sound to indicate being hit, you just have to watch your health percent and whatnot, there's no real damage delay either, you scrape by a zombie thing, touch foots and ow, there goes 8 or so percent of your health.
I have literally played better flash games, that were far more entertaining and well-made, compared to this.
Oh, and I was running this at 1280X720 with the settings set to fastest"
date: and came out at 20fps at best. This game is hilariously bad and I honestly
recommended: truly feel sorry for the couple of hours spent developing this.\n\nI paid 10 cents for this with a 90% off discount
hoursPlayed: and I want my 10 cents back."

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds is perhaps the worst first person shooter I've ever played. Up there with the likes of Daikatana for the Nintendo 64, and Elite Forces: Navy SEALS, The Slaughtering Grounds is what happens when a person does not understand the fundamentals of game design, nor cares to.

Where to begin?

The title screen of the game, which is used as a central hub for buying weapons and characters is a complete mess. Never mind the fact that I believe they used Arial as the font for the menu screens, the actual menu itself is visually apalling. Enemies that spawn in the background can be seen dropping into the actual menu, and the background itself is not composed in a visually stimulating way. Gee, Digital Homicide doesn't understand shot composition? Say it ain't so.

Delving into the actual game now, it's a complete clusterf*ck. For the first 10 seconds, your mouse cursor is out of alignment with the default weapon. It corrects itself, but this is laughably stupid. The goal of the game is to survive for 15 minutes, but there's no real reason to move from the spot you spawn at. The game doesn't, at any point, give you a reason to traverse the (ugly as hell) world you're put in. Exploration in the game only leads you to more zombies, as the game has no real goal beyond survival. The weapons themselves are decent, and I mean this purely from a weapon model perspective. They handle as if you were on drugs. They sway from side to side, as if you were standing on a boat and their ADS (aim-down-sights) seem to lag for a moment before you can actually see them.

Ammo for said weapons is spread through the levels, but because this was baby's first FPS, you can only grab ammo for the weapon you're currently holding. You can also pick up mines, but they will get you killed because of the horrible implementation, or lack thereof, of any real collision detection. Meaning that you can literally plant them in the ground, and walk right over them if you've forgotten they're there. The least Digital Homicide could have done in a case like this is had an animation of the player model digging up dirt with a cute pink shovel.

Alas, there are no kawaii shovels in this game.

The zombie AI ranges from absolutely horrendous, to non-existent. Their radar for movement could be described as broken, as it only seems to work half the time. You can outrun them, even if they do notice you. I'm not sure they can go up stairs. At one point in each level, the zombies become FRENZIED" and seem to be a bit smarter. In reality
recommended: so their radar is almost guaranteed to pick you up.\n\nBeyond all these problems
hoursPlayed: the game is marred by glitches and bugs as well. During my play of the game
voteText: I saw an airplane flying sideways. It then disappeared into a void
helpfulPercent: although it likely just collided with the horrendous skybox. There's elevator shafts that you can stand on in the first level
votesHelpful: but there's no ground to them
votesTotal: so you're basically standing on air. My health went down to -2% once
votesFunny: a feat which I haven't been able to replicate in any other game yet
commentsCount: sadly.\n\nIt's worth mentioning that every asset in this game is almost 100% sure to be bought from the Unity Asset Store. Because Digital Homicide are a group of hacks who don't understand game design
column16:
nor care to.

This game is currently being sold for 14 cents. Don't buy it.

And don't buy it for your friends either."

reviewText:
As someone who played this on the first day of beta, and had no swing to any side of whether it's good or bad I can say for a fact that I had fun in this game.

Thrown straight to Character Select with a somewhat hip-hop loop in the back; I was so god damn lost. I gave a look at the characters and decided to get all of them before I even got in.
Went in, shots were fired. No ammo left. Ran around completely lost looking for ammo. Died. Died so many times I wanted to punch something. Didn't. Just quit the game.

At this point I had like 1000 in cash.

Came back, same thing but I stuck it out to the apparent transition to the next map. This map. THIS MAP. THIS IS WHAT THE FIRST ONE SHOULD HAVE BEEN LIKE. There's plenty of room to run around, there's ammo and  health packs everywhere and taking out the zs was fun and didn't cluster around me and forced me to use more than one bullet for a headshot. The Shotgun was especially helpful in this map. EVERYTHING DIED.

After that slaughter fest, I got sent back to the first map (:<) but had a much better understanding of survival". Instead of using all of the start off ammo
date: I shot anyone in front of me while running around looking for the places that stuff spawns in.\nAfter repeating the two maps once more
recommended: I went on to Multiplayer because I didn't click Singleplayer (I accidentally clicked multiplayer) -- remember this if you keep playing -- The amount of money you get in Multiplayer is more than you get in Single. I managed to get the characters only an hour after release of the Beta
hoursPlayed: and upgraded the 3rd class.\n\nThe second map though. Holy ****. I can't emphasize this enough. There was ammo left and right
voteText:
so I managed to stack up to 1000 bullets for the M4 and the glock while gracefully smashing each and every single zombie-monsters head with a single glock bullet in 15 minutes. Sometimes 2 if the game felt like being realistic (or I just missed the first time).
The only reason /why/ I actually managed to go on longer than 10 minutes was the music. I can say without a doubt that I want the song so I can listen to it every day until I'm sick of it.

Now would one want to buy it? Not really. Although I did have fun doing things with absolute no consequences
helpfulPercent: the game as a whole -- is not even one could consider in beta. It's just plain ♥♥♥♥. There is nothing to it. Nothing that makes it stand out (other than the fact that I don't need to listen to anyone and can do what I want while shooting stuff :>). It was clearly not ready for it's beta title -- this needs a lot more work before it can even become subpar.\n\nI haven't bought any Greenlight games that I've voted even though there are many games that I really do want simply because I lack the funds. However. I will be buying this for sure when I can. Simply because of the joy it gives me when I want to kill ♥♥♥♥ for giggles in a different way."

reviewText:
First of all. I got this game for free. And it's HORRIBLE. First, the menu is an abomination. Second, it's a mess of default unity assets mixed up with one of the worst AI I've ever seen. It's a total nonsense. The song is a free rap song I heard a while ago, that loops over, and over, and over. It gets annoying after the third loop. The blood splatters are EXACTLY the same blood sprites I found on google some months ago, and I used them for a photoshop job I had to do for my school. You can walk THROUGH windows (Non-destroyed windows. With the glass and everything), the ammount of glitches is amazing (I saw a plane flying sideways while dropping some crap), and the worst of all: It's a generic damn shooter. You can clearly see that the developer placed NO effort onto this game. The netcode is horrible. The zombies, if you can call them that way, are damn weak. ANY weapon kills them in one hit. Aside, what the hell? There's like a nazi general zombie, a mime-like zombie, and other sprites that look a lot like the sprites you can download for free to add on any game. I dare to say even a 10-12 year old kid can make a better game than this, in just a few hours.

This game, is one of the few games I really hate. This, is from my point of view, even worse than bad rats. I mean, bad rats is WAY more enjoyable than this game, with it's cheap 60's porno music and bad physics.

Even if I got this for free, I demand a refund. Oh, and strangely, almost every positive review come from accounts that have just one review, and luckily, one game.

This game is a mess. 0/10

EDIT: This review is disliked by 1 person only. I'm sure it's the dev.

I got this game from a friend, as a joke. Jokes on him however, this game is one of the best out there.

I started playing this game, and after exactly 38 minutes, I had unlocked every character and all the weapons. Keep in mind, I bought TWO guns and two characters, and that was it. I felt an incredibly sense of accomplishment that I had managed such a feat.

Where to even begin with this gem? I suppose I could begin with the beautifully crafted menu for the game. When you start the game for the first time, you are greeted by a man named Snake, a biker in his right environment, and two zombies that drops down like ragdolls behind him, and believe it or not, some pretty good music, for the first 15 seconds before it starts all over again, but you have the choice of turning the music off, which is always a pleasant feauture to have available.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Quick player speed gives a sense of freedom.
- Ability to mute the soundtrack.
- Ability to hide the GUI.
- Fully configurable keyboard controls.
- On the second map, at just the right time, you could be lucky enough to witness an airplane fly and clip right through the side of a mountain, quite a spectauclar sight.
- A money system, so there was intention of creating replay value, but the game itself isnt too playable, for the following reasons:

Cons:
- Windows are just textures, you can't break them and you can jump through them.
- FPS issues (probably associated with the Unity engine). I don't own the best laptop, but when I play in fullscreened 640 x 480 with the lowest graphics possible I expect to at least muster a playable fps and minimal input lag. That is not possible with this game. I don't know Unity too well, but I reckon this could be fixed through ragdoll, gib, and spawnrate tweaks.
- No punishment for dying, you simply respawn, retaining your previous amount of ammo and cash. Actually, I take that back, the only punishment for dying is a bug responsible for taking some of your newly regained health away upon spawning.
- No in-game look sensitivity adjustment.
- Highly obstructive HUD.
- Trees, telephone booths, mailboxes, etc. almost all foilage and beauty objects in this game aren't interactable, meaning you can walk right through them.
- HUD blood effects and messages such as 'BLOOD BATH', 'RAMPAGE', etc are sloppily displayed. The low resolution and white around the edges leave me convinced that these effects were edited with Microsoft Paint.
- Negative health? Not necessarily an issue but it feels wierd dying with -%9997 health after stepping on my own landmine, whoops.

I'll be sure to add more to this list in the near future. I had a lot more thaings to add but I keep forgetting. If the dev comes across this I just want them to know that in my opinion, the most apparent gameplay hinder is the ridiculous FPS drop. Once that is fixed, the game will at least be playable.

reviewText:
An educational experience on how NOT to make a game,a boring shooter plagued by poor design,technical issues and horrible...well,everything.

PROS:

-gotta say I find the music catchy,even though there's a single track on loop.

CONS:

-horrible graphics,VERY low res textures,glitchy lightning,drab colours,horrible cut and paste blood textures on the screen.

-weak sounds.

-awful,awful optimization,on a GTX 680 this game runs choppy,the fps tanks suddendly and with no reason.

-terrible animations,frame skipping,jerky movements,corpses glitch everytime and start spazzing around.

-poor/buggy gameplay,mobs will glitch,item pickups work half the time,you get hit in melee from meters away,you slide down certain surfaces (like stairs,cause why not),you might get thrown in the air due to a bugged mob (but there's no fall damage so it's okay),multiplayer is useless (one map only,it never ends).

I got this in a bundle because I wanted to try yet another horrible game,and I was surprised to find it even worse than expected.

It's not worth it,maybe for free to laugh at it while you play for 10 minutes...but apart from it's dubious comedy value,no,it's rubbish,total rubbish.

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds is a FPS where you must survive a zombie onslaught for 15 minutes. You start off with a biker dude but can unlock more characters with unique weapons with cash you get from killing zombies. As soon as you start the game you are greeted with this small loop of music that is kind of catchy but will quickly get on your nerves as it is the only song in the game. And then you actually start the game and quickly wish you hadn't. You will occasionally spawn in a very unfortunate position and quickly lose a good chunk of health to zombies while quickly moving away. Zombies don't even attack, they will either stare at you or slap the air three feet away from you both of which cause damage somehow.

Well is gameplay fun you are probably thinking. Nope! The gunplay is extremely floaty and contact with zombies is very unsatisfying. Even worse is that you run out of ammo very quickly and have to go around the map searching for floating ammo crates for a pathetic amount of ammo to use and so the cycle continues indefinitely. All the while a horde of useless zombies slowly walk behind you posing no real threat. It is like a game of helping old people walk down the street as many zombies are also prone to stay in one place zoned out without a care in the world.  There are also health packs and mines littered around the map. Mines are useless though since they are only capable of taking out a single zombie even in a large swarm.

Well what happens if you are somehow killed by the zombies? Absolutely nothing, you just respawn without your mines but still have the same amount of ammo. That means if you die without ammo you will have to walk all the way over to an ammo crate and repeat that vicious cycle of needing ammo. At this point you will probably pause the game to rethink what you are dong with you life but good luck with that! All that does is bring up a sign in front of your character and everything else functions the same as it does while not paused. You can still walk, enemies can still attack you but now you can't shoot or walk sideways. Don't worry though. Even if you are at 0% health you can still walk around.

At this point you are probably praying that the 15 minutes to survive are nearly over and you take a glance at the timer. Well good luck figuring out what amount of time is left since the timer is prone to glitch out and start showing random bits of numbers. So you had enough, go to the top of a building and jump. Hah, nice try buddy, there is no fall damage! So on you walk and walk leading a horde of zombies like if the pied piper found a rotten skin flute and start humming along to the haunting loop of the same song that has been playing nonstop all this time. Forget about the nonfunctional timer, forget about the sweet prospect of death that will never come and continue walking all over the map, around and around.

An unspecified amount of time later you remember you have a gun in your hands and are supposed to kill these old pe...err, zombies. So bam bam bam! You kill and run around collecting the money they drop for the purpose of buying a bigger clip to to kill them more efficiently. And then you remember why you stopped killing in the first place. You are essentially doing the same thing walking around the map but now you searching for ammo. The zombies are still slowly walking behind you posing no real threat and you realize that YOU are the monster. Wow, this game is deep, such a beautiful message.....and the timer runs out, teleporting you to a new map. In which case the only correct course of action is to Alt+F4 out of the game and delete system32 to stop the evil you just witnessed. Highly recommended if you hate yourself and need that extra push into the depths of madness.

reviewText:
One of the worst games I have ever played it hurts my head after just 7 minutes.

This awful game has terrible graphics that don't even compliment it in any way, the combat system is pathetic with ammo being so limited you are better off getting a 1$ walking simulator and enjoy more action. And even if you get enough ammo and find some kind of way to enjoy this piece of trash, the hitboxes are so poorly coded that you take damage even when you are half a screen away from any zombie, completely destroying the game over again.

For the 0.10$ I spent on this, all I got was 5 minutes of boring and crap gameplay resembling a flash game and the ability to write this short review.

reviewText:
This game is really really bad (btw thank you for free key).
The UI occupies like 1/4 of the screen, and if disabled you can't really know if something hitting you, unless you have the sound enabled.
The sound is horrible, and the OST even worse.
The weapons are useless except shotgun, that is 1 shot kill in close quarters
The weapons occupies all the right side of the screen, when you zoom with the weapons nothing happens but the position of the weapon
The fact that you have to collect the money from the floor after killing a zombie is really annoying
When you're on a killing spree or you're hurt a paint-made sprite appears on the screen.
Please developers, there are cs 1.6 servers with better sprites of blood

reviewText: I know it's really overstated, but this game is as bad as people say it is.\n\nIgnoring the dev's shady behavior, the game is just incredibly boring to play. There is no penalty for dying whatsoever, and no objectives to go for. It's just a big arena with enemies for you to click on. And while there's some variety among the horde, they all have the exact same AI and animations, essentially making them the same enemy. Once in a while the game will announce that Zombies have become frenzied!"

reviewText:
I had watched Jim F*cking Sterling Son's Twitch stream. I was awed, surely a game like this didn't exist. Lo and behold! In all of it's shameful glory, I have found this game! As predicted by the one true god Jim, this game is lousey and poorly made, horrible graphics, and has atrocious animations. I had found a fabled smear in gaming history! I was afriad at first to aquire this game, but after hearing of the horrible demon Digital Homicide being defeated in battle, my curiosity spiked once more! Today is when it had finally peaked, and I had succumb to the lure of this dying siren. It was mostly as foretold, only the damage from fallen zombies was removed and another bood smear was used. Luckily though, the sight of the sideways aircraft flying through the skybox as if it were a wall gave a smile and I sang praise. I have now seen an expertly made example of horrible game design and am now better off for it...



Lets hope the Steam refund policy helps me become sane again.

reviewText:
If you ever wanted to know how would Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing look like if it was an FPS, this is the game for you.

If you ever wanted to know how a very, VERY ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game-cousin of Serious Sam or Killing Floor would look like, this is, again, the game for you.

If you were wondering if this game is really as bad as Jim ♥♥♥♥ing Sterling says it is, let me assure you that, yes, it really is.

The ammo is VERY limited - when you run out of it, which happens very fast, by the way, you are forced to run around the map, defenseless, in a desperate hunt for more ammo. No, there are no melee weapons. You truly are defenseless. Well, there ARE land mines and trip wire mines, but placing them is kinda awkward when you're being hunted by three or more zombies. Also, an occasional helicopter DOES drop ammo, but it only happens like, every ten or so minutes, and even then, I still don't know WHERE was the ammo dropped. Hell, the only reason I actually do know a helicopter dropped some ammo somewhere is helicopter propeller noise coming from somewhere in the distance. So much for THAT help".

Also

reviewText:
So after watching the pathetic digital homicide hilariously debate the all mighty and all knowing Jim F**king Sterling. I specifically remember hearing how digital homicide does NOT want anyone from Jim Sterlings audience to buy and play the game. So I decided to go to steam and to my surprise, the game was only $0.19! Which is a relief because I wouldn't pay anything more than $0.49 for this attrocious piece of crap of a game. I mean, 19 cents? It's practically free, it's like taking 1 dime, 1 nickle and 4 pennies out of my jar so I've got nothing to lose.

When I started playing the game, my immediate experiecne was frustraiting. The controls were beyond horrendous! The ammunition would run out fast and as soon as I ran out, I was screwed. I kept on dying. I tried real hard to find ammo, but thats a little hard to do when a horde of zombies keeps on chasing and killing you. Not to mention you move like a slug in this game. So finding ammo, avoiding enemies immediatly becomes a chore in this piece of sh*t of a game. I mean this was NOT fun at the very least. I only played it for 15 minutes and I am already sick of it. I deleted it from my library and will never play it again.

Remember digital homicide! As a member of Jim Sterlings audience, I was gonna take his word for it and never buy this game, until you said in the debate with him that you want none of his audience members to buy your game, so I did exactly that. I saw your crappy game on sale for only $0.19 and I decided to buy it. I played it. And its total crap! LOL!!!

And remember! Jim F**king Sterling Son sent me! LOL!!!!!!!!!!

My score:
-100000000000000000000000000000000/ 10

reviewText:
-------------Music/SFX-------------
The music is 30 seconds long and is looped continuously. There are no options to turn it down, the only option is to mute it or blew your eardrums listening to how loud it is.
The SFX is horrible. Zombie death sounds go on for way too long, gunshots are completely wrong, genuinely horrible sounds.
-------------Gunplay-------------
Due to the fact that your gun points to the center of the screen, there is no crosshair other than on the very tip of the weapon. Absolutely no recoil and basically unlimited ammo, this isn't a survival, this is just a camp-in-one-place-and-collect-health-and-a♥♥♥♥♥♥me. Gunplay is absolutely horrible and even if you aim down your sights, it's almost as bad as firing from the hip.
-------------Gameplay-------------
Singleplayer is exactly the same as Multiplayer - ONLY ONE PERSON ON. Yes, that's right! There's only one server on Multiplayer, and me and my friends went on it. We gave up after 20 mins. The radar and HUD is terrible, zombies make almost no noise (except when you shoot or kill them) and can hit you from a few metres away - and there's no way of knowing where you're getting hit from or if you're getting hit unless you're constantly staring at your health meter!
Online, the radar doesn't show your friends, and the chatbox tells you who's in the game because the dev couldn't be bothered to put a simple playerboard or leaderboard in. Instead they just got a bunch of assets off the unity store page.
Tip: If you want to make it through the 3 unity asset levels included in the game, just get yourself wedged between two zombies and walk backwards and jump. You fly into the air and land on the roof (if you want to). There's no fall damage, so you can fly a mile and not take damage.
-------------Character-------------
There's only one playable character in the game and you cannot customize your own - the only thing you can do is get better weapons for 1000 dollars each and then they keep on going up in price, so you have to kill a bunch of zombies with rubbish weapons.
-------------Graphics-------------
The graphics in this game are horrendous - and my computer can't run it! Even with 16 GB RAM, 2 GeForce GTX 970s (still testing 970s, not fully clocked yet, due to poor power supply), an AMD FX 9590 processor and 2 1 TB hardrives, this game still runs at less than 10 FPS.
My computer can run GTA V on max settings at 60+ FPS, so obviously this game is just utter garbage.
-------------Overall-------------
NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO

reviewText:
You know when things are so bad, they're good? Shadow the Hedgehog, 50 Cent: Blood on the Sand, Two Worlds, Dawn of War: Soulstorm's voice acting, etc.? This is not one of those things.

Pros:
I only had to spend 20 cents on it.
I have fallen madly in love with Snake, the first playable character, on appearance alone.

Cons:
The pause screen doesn't pause.
Half the assets (if not more) are stolen from elsewhere.
Everything looks thrown together.
You can only get ammo for your currently equipped gun.
The explosives don't work.
There is no reason to use any weapons besides the shotgun.
There is no reason to leave one building, as you can grab everything you need inside while still killing zombies.
The devs censor negative reviews and comments.
There is no reaspm to buy other characters, as you have to buy their secondary weapons, and they aren't as good as Snake and his shotgun.
Terrible framerate.
Many more.
I paid for it.

-10/10, will probably only play for trading cards.

reviewText: This was the worst game I have ever played on Steam until I played Galactic Hitman. Now it is the second worst game I have ever played. This game supports 64 player multiplayer, but the problem is that NOBODY is playing it. So it is basically a single player game. Imagine an arena-style horde mode game like Killing Floor, but then take away everthing that made that game good and that's what you will end up with.  There are no redeeming factors. Poor enemy AI, an ugly HUD not even fit for a mobile game, horrendous gunplay, guns lack recoil, and just don't feel satisfying in any way. It has one music track, which doesn't suit the atmosphere, and it gets old quickly. It is basicly a few notes that play for 30 seconds on a permanent loop. Playing this game made me lose respect in Valve/Steam service itself, for the lack of quality control. Not even worth the $0.14 cents I paid for it. Not even for free. It is that bad.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P15yHelL2m4&index=16&list=PLNCk-m24qgLkgLn0G_PjSKus4gRPcU69J

reviewText:
I only played a little bit and most of my time is collecting cards. I really feel that this game is one of the worst I've played. I paid 19 cents for it and made 2 cents profit by selling the cards, but I still feel ripped off. If you want to run around just to shoot the heads off of zombies, there are many, many other games out there that you should try instead. This game almost makes Bad Rats look decent.
The Slaughtering Grounds is surprisingly ugly and immemorable. I thought that it was my crap computer that caused it to lag and be so low quality, but it turns out that people with monster PCs still can't play this game at a tolerable framerate. The characters are terribly two dimensional and unappealing, almost as horribly made as the zombies. There is no story or purpose to the game other than to kill things and collect ammo. The game itself is in no way attractive or fun to play.

+ Trading cards might be worth it if the game is on sale. Might.

- Horrible framerate and boring appearance
- Stolen images. Bruh
- Zombie AIs are bad; randomly stopping, no movement, running in circles
- Zombies are super slow and follow a simple path when they actually do work, making them easy to keep away from as they follow you endlessly.
- Killing zombies is too easy, at least in the time that I played. I couldn't even play long enough to see if it got harder.
- When they die, they explode with blood and their head severs. It doesn't look good.
- Guns don't seem to line up with the crosshair and the recoil is disappointing. The guns don't feel right.
- The default character, Snake, made me want to hit myself in the face, the other two are generic zombie apocalypse characters, Bob or something and no-name.
- Music is irritating

This game has a reputation for a reason. Even if you got this game on sale for $0.19, it still probably isn't worth it. Save that $0.19 on another cheap game that isn't as horrid.

reviewText: Wow.. just wow. The Slaughtering Grounds reminded me how bad some games can be. From the pixelated Cash:" at the main menu
date: the totally out of place metal pattern for the borders surrounding the text to the blood effects that were taken straight from Google Images.\n\nIn the game you start off by shooting zombies which is pretty cool but after a few shots you run out of ammo. Even though all the ammo boxes show bullets on the boxes
recommended: it seems to give ammo only to the shotgun? Sometimes it doesnt even give you ammo but the ammo box disappears? I just suppose this is one of the many flaws and bugs in the game. When you are walking around and you get hit you don't even notice it most of the time as there is no sound or effect when you get hit. You only start noticing when the blood shows up on your screen or if you die. When you respawn you ofcourse lose all your ammo which feels just like getting shanked in your left asscheek. The money counts up too slow so it takes ages to get enough to buy a new character.\n\nI do however enjoy the fact you can one-shot zombies with a shotgun as in a lot of other games it takes multiple shots. As I use a French keyboard I have to set my "walk north" to 'Z' and my "walk west" to 'Q'. Even though I change these settings at the start up "ui Configuration"-window (doesn't even show a logo or mention the name of the game in the window)
hoursPlayed:
they never seem to get applied so I have to actually change the layout of the keyboard in my Windows settings. The game also gets incredibly boring fast as there is just one map (I think?).

To summarize;
Pros:
You can one-shot zombies with a shotgun
Cons:
Many graphics (and concept artwork) are literally stolen without giving credit
After listening for 5 minutes to the soundtrack it makes you wonder if life would be better in a padded cell in an insane asylum
Messy controls that you cant even set up
Sounds effects are missing where there should be and the ones that are used often seem wrong for their purpose
Even at 0.99$ this game still seems like a rip-off"

reviewText:
You know when things are so bad, they're good? Shadow the Hedgehog, 50 Cent: Blood on the Sand, Two Worlds, Dawn of War: Soulstorm's voice acting, etc.? This is not one of those things.

Pros:
I only had to spend 20 cents on it.
I have fallen madly in love with Snake, the first playable character, on appearance alone.

Cons:
The pause screen doesn't pause.
Half the assets (if not more) are stolen from elsewhere.
Everything looks thrown together.
You can only get ammo for your currently equipped gun.
The explosives don't work.
There is no reason to use any weapons besides the shotgun.
There is no reason to leave one building, as you can grab everything you need inside while still killing zombies.
The devs censor negative reviews and comments.
There is no reaspm to buy other characters, as you have to buy their secondary weapons, and they aren't as good as Snake and his shotgun.
Terrible framerate.
Many more.
I paid for it.

-10/10, will probably only play for trading cards.

reviewText: I am hesitant to call The Slaughtering Grounds a game. It feels more akin to a programming student's first project in Unity, so I feel less like I am critiquing a game and more like I am grading a homework assignment. That being said, The Slaughtering Grounds is a survival horror zombie based first person shooter ... in theory. It follows the trend put forth by games like Left 4 Dead and Killing Floor. In fact from the title and the gameplay choices made by the developer, I am fairly certain this game IS in fact intended to be a copy of Killing Floor.\n\nLike Killing Floor, The Slaughtering Ground features multiple classes with different weapons ... that is to say three classes with two weapons. And there is a wide variety of zombies to kill ... and by that I mean despite the motley crew of zombies (like police officers, prisoners, girl scouts, and hulking luchadors among others) they all fight the same way. As you fight your way through the one of two stages (that repeat), you'll notice that there's no indicator that you're being damaged apart from the spilled strawberry jam on your screen and your health slowly being eaten away. Because your character does not cry out in pain or the screen indicate when you are being wounded, you could have the Nemesis-like zombie chewing your arm off from behind and the only way you'd notice is if you look at your health bar going down and realize, Huh
date: it looks like something is attacking me."\n\nThe weapon system is one of the worst I've seen in such a game. Your character will have two guns plus landmines and trip mines. You do not get a melee weapon which goes against survival horror design philosophy and doesn't help that ammunition can be hard to come across at first. The goal of the level is to survive until the time is up
recommended: but death has no consequence on your progress. If you die
hoursPlayed: you retain anything you had when you died and the time continues to go down. Also unlike other zombie games
voteText: zombies do not always actively look for you. In fact many just stand around in one place waiting for you to get close to them.\n\nOne of the biggest issues from a technical standpoint is the slowdown of the game. For whatever reason
helpfulPercent: the first level does not optimally play. Even if you have a top of the line computer
votesHelpful: the horrendous framerate of the first stage will make you feel like you're running Battlefield 4 on a Pentium II. Strangely enough the other stage (and the repeat of the first stage) do not have this issue. And one of the biggest issues from an aesthetic standpoint is the music. There is only one song in the game and it has a short loop length and doesn't really fit with the game's theme. My advice if you plan on playing this game is to turn the music off from the game menu and put on some music of your choice
votesTotal: preferably some heavy metal
votesFunny: death metal or ABBA.\n\nThe game does offer SOME enjoyment however. Mostly this comes in the form of zombie corpses which twitch and move around in unnatural ways after they die. The first time you kick the berserker zombie's corpse clear across the stage is sure to get a laugh. And you can run right through treees and glass windows without breaking them or taking damage. But ... if you want to play an excellent class based multiplayer zombie first person shooter
commentsCount: I highly recommend you play Killing Floor instead."

reviewText:
Review Time:

I figured now that there's been a little while between the launch and the current day that it would be time to write a review... oh dear god....

First things first, if I could get one special gift for christmas this year, it would be a ban from Digital Homicide Studios creating games and getting them steam greenlit. If the developer was paying me to play this game, I would still be asking for my money back. If you have absolutely nothing else to do, then yes, spend the few cents this game costs right now during the summer sale, you will regret it but do it.

Alright, next the game allows you to turn off the music, thank god because it was poorly designed... so you go to the multiplayer screen and guess what? The infernal ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ music is back, and it comes back almost as often as the developer does to produce games in 2 months and release them. It is actually disgusting how terrible and unfitting the music is.

Next we go to the animations and textures - sure the gun shoots, the zombies kind of move/walk/levitate across the floor (all of this on the highest settings). I also managed to run up some stairs, jump onto part of the roof and fall through it into the building, no glass smashing noises, just standard fall it, doesn't matter, the roof is an illusion. The textures and such are the most terrible I have ever seen.

Do not get me started on the wide array of guns and weapons at the start of the game. 'Pick between pistol or shotgun' - get both either way... floating ugly ammo boxes to restock.

Now for the quick list of good things about this game - Steam has released it on sale (altough that £0.15 should be £0.00 or £0.01). Second good thing, it actually turns on. End of list of good things.

The developer is churning out unfinished, unpolished games in an attempt to make money, and will accuse people of slander or lies because of what they say, as well as resorting to banning accounts from forums and discussion due to any criticism. Apparently it is rude to say that the game was indeed poorly begun (cannot say made as it would refer to it as something beyond pre-pre-pre-pre-pre-early alpha.

Waste of time and money.

reviewText:
This is no AAA ZFPS. Mechanically, it's quite in shambles. So? I read in the description that it has nuts blood and physics... for laughs. This means that if you're looking for a serious, beautiful game, stay away. Personally, I'm digging it. There are one or two fatal flaws I noticed which, if fixed, would make this my go to silly game.

FPS suuuuuuucks. Perhaps its the physics being ramped up, perhaps its the engine being utilized (looked the same as starforge, which also had/has similar issues/ hatred abounding) Fix my FPS to a stable 60, hell... 30, and that resolves the major grief.

The spawn situation: enough ammo to start, random spawn. OK, great, but I died with 0 ammo... respawned next to 2 big Zs with 0 ammo again? sometimes swithing weps a few times aused ammo to magially appear. Another reviewer says disabling gui gives infinite... that is a falsehood. As a fan of this game, here's what I'd like to see... respawn with the starting amount of ammo, every time. But I had 130 rds of SG ammo when I died... when you die, drop a crate with your stuff in it. And even better, TAC insertion ie. you pick where to spawn. I fancy a certain roof cuz there is ammo nearby... let me choose to spawn there.

Question: what the hell is the zombies are frenzied" even supposed to mean? It got dark and laggy
date: but that was all I noticed.\n\nI do like that you an outrun the Zs
recommended: which is the best strategy at first. Run to a building with visible stairs
voteText: kill Zs close by the roof or balcony
helpfulPercent: then you're basically set.\n\nI also like that you an move through windows. Please don't "fix" that. Zombies can also move through fences. Don't "fix" that cuz beggars can't be choosers. I once got knocked waaaay up into the sky (got a screencap) and did not die on landing. I jumped off a 2 story balcony and took 2% dmg. (silly

reviewText:
Jesus christ on a stick, I don't know where to begin. This game is really really bad. I really can't think of anything positive to say about it. For starters, being poorly optimized is an understatement. My PC can handle anything out right now and yet on the highest setting I'm getting 10 to 25 FPS. You start with 2 guns with very limited ammo scattered randomly throughout the level. You can't tell when you get hit. There is virtually no hit direction. The graphics are blend, flat and something out of a PS1 era with low standards. Not even good PS1 graphics. I paid 19 cents for this and I still feel like I got cheated out of my money. If you get this game, do it for the cards, if not, stay away. And I thought Bad Rats was bad but at least it was more optimized then this piece of ♥♥♥♥ of a game. 0/10

reviewText:
I've played games. I've played bad games. I've played Ride to Hell. I've played Desert Bus. I've played E.T on Atari. I've been in a gas station restroom, where the last ten guys forgot to flush. Nothing, i mean NOTHING comes clost to THIS. My god, this game is bad on so many levels that, not only am I surprised its still on steam, I'm surprised its legal to purchase this game. Perhaps I'm overreacting. Let's analyze (tear apart) this game (monstroity, abomination of human creation, etc.)

Graphics:
Surprisingly one of the best things about this game. That doesn't mean much. Most indie games look like they should run on an Xbox 360, but not a PS3. Some indie games look like they should run on Xbox or PS2. Some indie games purpousefully look like they should run on a Super Nintendo. It's hard to describe how this game looks. Let's look at a game called Doom. It came out early 90s, and revolutionized gaming. It had great level design, replayabillity, and overall, it was fun. The only thing about Doom that hasn't aged well is the graphics. you can make things out, but not from a distance. Fast forward twenty years. The Slaughtering grounds makes Doom look like Black Ops 3. One might say, at least Slaughtering Grounds is in 3D!" That is exactly the problem. You can't tell what is what. I can't put into words how all of the original graphics look. Keyword: original. lots of content in this game was stolen. the blood splatter on the screen

reviewText:
By far the worst game I've ever played, but somehow I did keep playing for about half an hour, I think?

You start off with a character with a revolver and a shotgun, which appear to be the best weapons in the game, from what I've seen (the shotgun, at least. Couldn't care less about the revolver). I played enough time (most of it in multiplayer, which had some people playing at the time, much to my surprise) to unlock a second character, a military guy with two assault rifles. Both of the weapons the unlockable character has, are way worse than the shotgun. They are less accurate at range (any range), eat through ammo like crazy and take up most of the screen. Haven't tried the third and last character yet, but I'm not sure if I'll be bothered to play enough to unlock that one too.

From what I've seen, there's a single map. That's it. One map. The map itself is okay-ish. The spawns are less then ideal, mostly because you spawn almost instantly after you've died and most spawns are surrounded by zombies" that will charge at you the moment you're up.

The UI takes up way too much of the screen. I think it would have been better if most of it was at least reduced in size or something
date:
since I don't actually need huge images of the weapons I've got at the bottom of the screen.

tl;dr:
The game is bad. Like
recommended: really bad.\n\nBut! It was only 20 cents when I bought it. Go to a local supermarket and see how much you can get for 20 cents. I dare bet there's very little in there that might bring you some dumb entertainment for... How long did I play it? 30 Minutes or so? And
voteText: I heard the developer say that this is one of his first games and that he's improving his game developing skills
helpfulPercent: so why not buy this crap for 20 cents to support him and see if he can do better in the future?\n\nStill not sure if this is a yes or no for recommending
votesHelpful: though. I think I'll make it a "no" for now
votesTotal: since the game is in a very bad state for now. Who knows
votesFunny: maybe he'll return to this some day to clean things up

reviewText:
So after playing the game for about half an hour i can write a review about pros and cons

Pros
+ Option to mute music
+ Able to upgrade weapons
+ Steam Trading Cards

Cons
- The music is an ear-grating 40 second loop you can't escape from
- Whenever you die the music comes back, forcing you to mute everytime
- When you die, it does not restart you back to the main menu, you respawn back in the game without guns
- Variations of enemies lack, they all charge at you (Maybe some do different things but do you care?)
- The enemy A.I doesn't work well, they might run into walls or do nothing until you bump them
- Too many enemies will spawn in making the game run even worse
- Picking up ammo only counts for the gun you're holding
- Collision detection on pickups is bad while running
- Enemies will spawn out of thin air
- No indication of you getting hit except poorly added blood splats

There are more problems with this game i just don't want to list them

My score 1/5

reviewText:
I bought this on discount at 99 cents.It wasnt worth it, but thankfully I paid a minimum, so thank god for small favours.The game is so half baked, that it looks as if someone took a tutorial on how to build an fps in the unity game engine and decided to publish the result on Steam as it is.

Which begs the next 2 questions, who on earth would greenlight it, and most importantly, Steam doesnt check the quality of whatever is submitted to them?

To be fair, the game might be at least roughly working, but that 's about it.


Stay Clear at all costs (literally)!


EDIT: To all users who say that this game is good, go see or try Killing Floor 1 or even better, KF2.Then return to this software (if you can call it that) and honestly judge if you still think it holds any quality whatsoever.

My biggest regret than buying this game is that I cannot get a refund for it on Steam, dont make the same mistake.

reviewText:
I had a really good time with this fantastic video game. This was comparable to the greats like Halo 3 and Bioshock 2. This game was well worth the currency I spent on it. Well worth the time of the install too. Have you ever played Metal Gear Solid 5; If yes then you can get an idea what kind of gunplay this game features. Sometimes I wonder what kind of game I was born to play when I look at Steam and this is definitely it. I wish you could all experience this video game as I have. I can't express to you enough how good this game was. Sorry for this long paragraph.

I hope you decide to spend your hard earned money on this video game. This game had more effort put into it than Bioshock Infinite and Halo 4 put together.

~Dane

reviewText:
I paid nineteen cents for this game.

- The GUI takes up a huge chunk of the screen. Thankfully, you can turn it off.
- I'm not so sure that the radar works correctly. At the very least, I can't tell where I am on it. The center? Whatever. It's unnecessary, and again, you can turn it off. (Edit: The center dot that shows where I am just didn't load. Worked when I restarted.)
- There's no sound when you are taking damage. Just being near the zombies seems to damage you, and your health disappears very quickly.
-There's a blood effect that appears around the edge of the screen when you take damage that doesn't seem to go away. Wouldn't mind so much if it didn't take up half the screen. If you're playing with the GUI and radar on, and this effect starts, you'll be pretty much blind.
- Item pickups are huge, but are still difficult to pickup for some reason.
- There's one music loop that plays constantly while the game is running. It's really out of place. You can turn it off though.
-On the whole, I don't really have any idea what the hell I'm supposed to be doing. I shoot zombies, run out of ammo pretty much immediately, and then spend the rest of the time searching for ammo and respawning.
-Fun fact: When you die, just keep pressing the spacebar to ascend to heaven!

There's a lot more than that, but I don't want to spend more time writing the review than I did playing the game.

I wouldn't recommend buying this for yourself. Gift it to somebody you really hate.

reviewText: I've refrained from reviewing Digital Homicide games, of which I own several, since I don't like to kick a dead dog.  I just want it to be said that I can find no redeeming qualities in this game, nor in any of their other titles.  Their business model is shoveling these flipped-asset games onto the Steam store for cheap--or alternatively inserting them all into a bundle--and then profiting off the cards.  No effort, except to steal certain work from other developers.  Every single card sold nets them at least a penny.  Keep that in mind when buying games on the cheap for the cards."\n\nI award no points
date: and may God have mercy on their soul."

Justin Bieber, Jb's Fans, Pewdiepie, Pewdiepies Fans, Rebeca Black and her Fans, EA, Ubisoft, Every clopper on the planet, Call Of Duty, Little kids who screams on the microphone shouting racist things, Video makers, Kim Kardashian, and every other celebrity who got famouse for doing nothing. Every single time I play this game I think of these little ♥♥♥♥s or in other words Cancer and Aids combined.

The Review: This game got me into it when Jim Sterling played it and I regret my decision and I supported the Piece of ♥♥♥♥ company IMMENENT UPPRISING for Banning every user who gave the game a bad reputation. Anyways lets get to the game

The gameplay: The gameplay isnt something new, its a First Person Shooter with bad Framerate isseus ( FWI I have a beastly Pc were I can run Witcher 3 on Maximum graphics) you need to be holding the gun you want ammo from because the developers couldnt code diffrent ammo types.

The graphics: The graphics feel like ♥♥♥♥"

It costs 100$ to put a game on Greenlight and whoever made this got a lot of attention towards his product since some popular youtuber made a video review on this game."Digital Homicide Studios" has probably made a few thousand dollars by now.All that because people nowadays  love negativity (in a tasteless way).

Well played Digital Homicide."

reviewText:
The Butchering Lands
or the misadventures of myself playing a mediocre game.

There was me, that is Dr. M and nobody else in particular. It was just me; no one to share the pain or anyone else to exchange my deepest feelings with. Not only was I very much alone, but I was also surrounded by tons of reanimated corpses, or zombies.

Now, dear reader, you are probably wondering: what am I doing in a place like this? Was it something I did? Was it because I had ignored the never-ending argument between my friends over half-understand concepts of politics? Yep, it was probably the latter reason.

Here, is how I got into this mess:
My boredom had reached dangerously low levels and I had to do something about it.  There was this game called The Slaughtering Grounds, which was a hideously generic first-person shooter where you GOTTA SHOOT DA ZOMBIEZ, CUZ WHEN YA SEE DA ZOMBIEZ YA GOTTA KILL THEM, END OF STORY. I thought to myself: why must I shoot the zombies? Why do they have to be portrayed this way? Why must we always make the assumption that we must end their un-life whenever we see them?

At the very beginning of the game, I was given two weapons to start off with: a revolver and a shotgun. Both of them did excellent at close-range combat, killing my undead enemies in one or two shots. Echoing across dimensions, there was this AWFUL soundtrack that looped infinitely and seemed to burrow into your ears after the first two times of listening to it. After I had killed three zombies, my ammo was running low. I sighted a floating container not far from my current location, so I sprinted towards it. I was somewhat relieved to see the ammo counter on my revolver fill back up, but when I switched to my shotgun, I realised with horror that the ammo crate I picked up earlier only contributed to the WEAPON CURRENTLY EQUIPPED, NOT OTHER WEAPONS.
“♥♥♥♥.” I muttered aloud. Yes, that means that my revolver was the only recipient for the ammo crate, which means I had to find ANOTHER ammo crate in order to fill up my shotgun. After I had successfully replenished all my ammo stores (yes, I had to individually locate several crates in different locations which was a chore to do), I was ready to handle this abomination of a game.

Since the zombie types were anything but varied and were fairly easy to take down, I was given the chance to observe the map I was playing on. The literal ground where all this slaughtering took place was void of any detail and so static I could almost hear the white noise in my head. Nothing really changed when the timer finished. I simply got teleported to another location where I could do the same thing. Rinse and repeat.

Hell, it didn’t even allow melee combat. Not a knife, not a sword, not ANYTHING. Not even the BUTT OF YOUR GUN, because you’re gonna need that to BASH YOURSELF IN THE HEAD LATER, FOR PLAYING THIS COMPLETE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥IZATION OF KILLING FLOOR.

Killing Floor? What’s that? I’ll tell you what it is: it’s what The Slaughtering Grounds is based off of. Hell, the latter game’s title is practically the former game’s except they reworded it. Killing Floor. Slaughtering Grounds. And now, The Butchering Lands, which is my own work. Frankly, Killing Floor is a hell of a lot better than Slaughtering Grounds in every single aspect. Even the single player of Killing Floor is WAY more interesting.

Story wise, Slaughtering Grounds has none. Just simply dumps you into an arena and shoot zombies, because narrative takes too much EFFORT. There is only a small character description when you choose who you want to play as, and believe me; all of those characters have a back story that makes a ♥♥♥♥ing WALL look like ROALD DAHL. Cripes, I could stare into the cloudy depths of my coffee and I could get more inspiration from it than I did with this game made by tiny-baby developers who haven’t a clue what originality is.

If this is not enough to prevent you from purchasing this game, let me tell you this: the developers of Slaughtering Grounds aren’t any better than their product. When a certain game journalist named Jim Sterling reviewed the game and dubbed it “an absolute failure”, the tiny-baby developers threw a tiny-baby hissy fit and flipped out. They called Jim a “♥♥♥♥ing idiot” and claimed his criticism was harming their copyright.
…really? Well, you can read about the whole mess in the link listed below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S6s0Wpn1zmU

Anyway, for your sake and for your wallet’s sake (the game is on sale for barely a dollar, there are more worthy games at that price), buy something else.
Oh, and by the way, since I am the one who bought this game, I shall create a story that basically sums up this encounter:
My name is Dr. M and I have succeeded in failing the human race. I tried to build the perfect human, but have only accomplished in wasting money, time and recourses. Now, it is my duty to destroy that which I have created. This is my ultimate fate. No one else is to be involved in this. No more lives need to be harmed; I wish to be the only one whose life will be lost amidst this travesty.
Farewell, I wish you a good life and may you find better indie games out there.
---Dr. M

reviewText:
This game is every bit as bad as it has been made out to be.  Do not buy it,  not even to try it for yourself,  it isn't worth spending even a cent on.

As for why?

Well, ignoring all the drama behind this game,  you basically have a very simple shooter.   Since your character starts with the best gun in game already (The shotgun)  there is zero incentive to try to advance.  Advancement,  is simply gathering cash from killed enemies,  (all of whom die in one hit, from the shotgun).

Once you find a place that has more ammo spawns, than zombies,  that's pretty much it.   No reason to get more cash,  and at 15 minutes the game switches levels,  no boss, no mini-boss, no story.  So nio reason to really advance, or do anything.

This is one of the worst games I've ever played.  It deserves all the ire it has gotten,  and that the dev would take pride in such work is beyond me.   Just remove this from steam.

reviewText: Another tradgedy made by the properly named Digital Homicide studios. There really isn't much to say about this one. Poor combat mechanics paired with awful AI a drolling soundtrack of the same 5 seconds of a song looped over and over again. And you've got yourself prepped for just about any of the Digital Homicide Studio's games. But this one in particular is probably one of the worst offenders being somewhere above temper tantrum but below Forsaken Uprising. In short everything about this game is awful and it's honestly not even worth the 14 cents on sale much less so the 99 cent original asking price. So get this game with caution as it is essentially a visual lobotomy. Unless you wan't to laugh at this with friends donate your 14 cents towards something good like raising money for animal shelters. 1/10 Absolute ♥♥♥♥♥. If you want to see gameplay here is a link.\nhttps://youtu.be/7m6_FeshNSA

reviewText:
Product received for free

I won a giveaway on SteamGifts yesterday, it was supposed to be The Slaughter act one, but when I activated the key and found out that I received the wrong game, I knew that my life was going to change forever, and not for the best.

I can't express how my playtime was more than enough to force me to convince me that suiciding by hanging is not as scary as they tell us.

You are probably here because you want to buy this game and have fun with you friends with this piece of crap, pointing out glitches and how terrible the devs are, and you don't even think about the fact that this garbage shouldn't even exist in the first place.

You can do your homework so your daddy can buy you a new Iphone, you silly self-defeating kid, or even hit the gym or just turn off your computer and do something that is actually worth your time.

This needs to stop.
STOP.

reviewText:
Summary

Ten years have passed since the fall of Durkadurkadom, and the American hero Snake still has not returned to his kingdom in New Jersey. A large and rowdy mob of zombies who have overrun Snake’s palace and pillaged his land continue to court his wife, Britany. She has remained faithful to Snake. The young bro Bruno, Snake’s son, wants desperately to throw them out but does not have the confidence or experience to fight them. One of the zombies, Brad, plans to assassinate the young bro, eliminating the only opposition to their dominion over the palace.

Unknown to the zombies, Snake is still alive. The beautiful Shaniqua, possessed by love for him, has imprisoned him on her island, Long Beach. He longs to return to his wife and son, but he has no ship or crew to help him escape. While the gods and goddesses of Trenton debate Snake’s future, Michelle, Snake’s strongest supporter among the gods, resolves to help Bruno. Disguised as a friend of the bro’s grandfather, Vinny, she convinces the prince to call a meeting of the assembly at which he reproaches the zombies. Michelle also prepares him for a great journey to Jackson and Howell, where the kings Eddy and Stan, Snake’s companions during the war, inform him that Snake is alive and trapped on Shaniqua’s island. Bruno makes plans to return home, while, back in New Jersey, Brad and the other zombies prepare an ambush to kill him when he reaches port.

At Trenton, Obama sends Joe Biden to rescue Snake from Shaniqua. Joe Biden persuades Shaniqua to let Snake build a ship and leave. The homesick hero sets sail, but when Mitt Romney, god of the sea, finds him sailing home, he sends a storm to wreck Snake’s ship. Mitt Romney has harbored a bitter grudge against Snake since the hero blinded his chum, Santorum, earlier in his travels. Michelle intervenes to save Snake from Mitt Romney’s wrath, and the beleaguered king lands at Brosia, home of the Brosians. Broseff, the Brosian princess, shows him to the royal palace, and Snake receives a warm welcome from the king and queen. When he identifies himself as Snake, his hosts, who have heard of his exploits at Durkadurkadom, are stunned. They promise to give him safe passage to New Jersey, but first they beg to hear the story of his adventures.

Snake spends the night describing the fantastic chain of events leading up to his arrival on Shaniqua’s island. He recounts his trip to the Land of the Planet Fitness, his battle with Santorum, his love affair with the witch-goddess Sarah Palin, his temptation by the deadly ratchet ♥♥♥ hoes, and his fight with the sea monster Snooki. When he finishes his story, the Brosians return Snake to New Jersey, where he seeks out the hut of his faithful swineherd, Jake. Though Michelle has disguised Snake as a beggar, Jake warmly receives and nourishes him in the hut. He soon encounters Bruno, who has returned from Jackson and Howell despite the zombies’ ambush, and reveals to him his true identity. Snake and Bruno devise a plan to massacre the zombies and regain control of New Jersey.

When Snake arrives at the palace the next day, still disguised as a beggar, he endures abuse and insults from the zombies. The only person who recognizes him is his old nurse, Sammi, but she swears not to disclose his secret. Britany takes an interest in this strange beggar, suspecting that he might be her long-lost husband. Quite crafty herself, Britany organizes an archery contest the following day and promises to marry any man who can string Snake’s great bow and fire an arrow through a row of twelve axes—a feat that only Snake has ever been able to accomplish. At the contest, each zombie tries to string the bow and fails. Snake steps up to the bow and, with little effort, fires an arrow through all twelve axes. He then turns the bow on the zombies. He and Bruno, assisted by a few faithful servants, kill every last zombie.

Snake reveals himself to the entire palace and reunites with his loving Britany. He travels to the outskirts of New Jersey to see his aging father, Jionni. They come under attack from the vengeful family members of the dead zombies, but Jionni, reinvigorated by his son’s return, successfully kills Brad’s father and puts a stop to the attack. Obama dispatches Michelle to restore peace. With his power secure and his family reunited, Snake’s long ordeal comes to an end.

There you go. I just told you the entire story you dont have to buy the game.
