reviewText:
I gifted 4 copies of this game to some Steam friends. All 4 removed me. This game ruins friendships, literally.

Now, for an actual review.

I'm assuming you've heard the contreversy of Digital Homocide studios, so I won't go into too much detail. These guys make terrible games, and that's apparent by now. It's fine to make a bad game, but if you lash out and remove other people's content for the showing true and honest reviews of YOUR game, then you're a ♥♥♥♥.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WT0GSPxf0vw

This is a voice over of an actual video these guys made, making fun of someone who didn't like they're game. There is an entire saga on all the ♥♥♥♥♥y things Digital Holocaust has done.

As for the game, it's a complete pile of horse ♥♥♥♥. The entire game is a bug. It runs at terrible framerates no matter how good your rig is. The gameplay is terrible. You can lose health just by being in a 3 mile radius of a zombie, and it only uses assets from Unity and Google Images. Yes, you read that correctly, Google, Images. This game is a scar on my Steam account that I can not remove. You shouldn't charge money for this game, you should ♥♥♥♥ing give money to the victims of this horrible mess.

Do I recommend this game? Oh. Hell. No. Do not buy this game, and especially don't buy other people this game, as they will remove you.

reviewText: The devs must have been on crack when they thought this game was a finished product. This game has so many bugs and glitches I could have made a better game while taking a sh*t on my iphone. The game's graphics look like a game from 2000 not from 2014. There is not 1 unique thing this game brings to the table. u can complete the game in 45 mins because u spend 15 mins on each map and there are only 3 maps. If  u r wondering Why 15 mins" Its because the levels are timed and if u think tht if it has a timer u need to survive tht amount of time then u r WRONG! If u die the timer continue so there's basically no point of the timer
date: so tht means tht there is no way to lose at this game. Tht means tht I can only reccomend this to are for people tht havn't beaten one video game in their life so tht they can say "Hey. I beat the Slaughtering Grounds" But then ur friends will just feel sorry for u. The maps seem like the same thing they have the same buildings around the maps so the only the thing tht changes is the scenary or the time of day. There is ammo around the map and u need to be holding the gun u want ammo for because the devs rushed this game out with no anticipation from people so there is noo need to rush out an unanticipated game. When the game starts up it s at 60fps bu then immediately drops to 20. The best thing about this game is tht I can laugh at it as the game is so bad tht it's good similar to Day One: Garry's Incident but I would choose to play Day One: Garry's Incident over this any day.The music loops incesently it's a 10 second loop of 1 song so if u play this game (WHICH YOU SHOULDN'T!) you will be listening to tht same 10 second loop for 45 mins.A weird thing I noticed is tht on the 3rd map the POV seems to zoom in. It dosn't happen on the other maps only the last one. Another thing tht I noticed about this game is tht it seems to take things from other things. The zombies look like they were ripped ff from resident evil 2. The blood splatters are from google images and they didn't bother to remove the white texture behind them... Wait... Why would the blood stick to ur screen? Does the blood just stick to ur eyeballs when u shoot the zombies? ANSWER ME HOMICIDE STUDIOS AND THT IS WHT THIS STUDIO IS DOING TO ME I FEEL LIKE    THEY ARE STABBING ME EVERY 5 MINS WITH A KNIFE SO THEY CAN SLOWLY WHATCH ME BLEED TO DEATH FOR THEIR OWN PERSONAL ENJOYMENT WHILE THEY COUNT THE MOUNT OF MONEY THT THEY GOT FROM OVER 1000 PEOPLE EVERY ONE PAYING 79P FOR IT AND THIS GAME ISN'T WORTH THT EITHER! THE BAD THING IS I BOUGHT THE COLLECTION OF HOMICIDE STUDIO'S GAMES! THE COLLECTION WAS ON DEAL FOR 79P FROM THE USUAL £3.99 AND I THINK I WAS RIPPED OFF WITH 79P I WILL GO INTO MORE RANTS WITH THOSE GAMES! WATCH OUT "DEADLY PROFITS"
hoursPlayed:
"MEDIEVAL MERCS" AND "TEMPER TANTRUM" CAUSE IM COMIN FOR U NEXT!

-Developer continued to makegames after this

-It'sthe worst game of 2014
-Buggy zombies w bad A.I.

Verdict: 1/10

reviewText:
This game has many amazing mechanics. I'm actually suprised that they could fit this many awesome game mechanics in just a tiny 380MB download!

One of these previously mentioned mechanics is invincible glass! Never worry about pesky zombie snipers again!

It also has a gambling mechanics - you have to make a gamble on whether an object has physics or not! Those trees? No physics! Good Job! Those giant fuel containers over there? You can walk straight through those beasts! Your prize? Knowing what NOT to attempt to parkour on!

Another amazing game defining mechanic is that no matter where you shoot zombies, their heads ALWAYS explode! Get that glorious headshot feeling no matter how bad you are at aiming!

These and many other absolutely fabulous mechanics are why I would reccomend this game to any person who asks. I even got it at a discounted price for only 15 cents! What a bargain!

reviewText:
This game. Truly great.

This game is a shining example of what the Unity Engine is capable of.
Some games like Kerbal Space Program or Subnautica make you really wonder what such an engine is capable of and make many think the engine is a joke. This game is great in every sense.

First off it starts and you're greeted with an Avant garde minimalist menu. Is it practical? No, it's art.
The minimalist themes continue with the brilliant musical loop of 30 seconds, short and concise. As well, beyond a very minimalist desktop shortcut, there is no edited logo for when the game is running (seen in the taskbar.)

Next is the gameplay, and this is the most hardcore survival game by far. There's so little ammo available on the map, you need to make sure that the 10 shotgun shells or 8 pistol rounds you get, at a time, are used wisely to diffuse the 10-20 zombies that often chase you and grow in numbers.

As 10-20 zombies chase you and you seek out ammo, and don't find it because the game is so hardcore, you’ll notice how huge the map is, not at all. Again the minimalism. Big maps are bad because it's easy to get lost. DigiHom gets this. This map is small and concise so you know where the ammo will not be. Brilliant design.

Atmosphere is fantastic as well. The game is usually so dark it's almost impossible to see the zombies unless I increase the contrast of my monitor and fry my eyes. Amazingly dark and spooky, really adding to the whole run in circles chased by zombies only to almost never find ammo. Very emotionally representational of the feeling of hopelessness as would be brought on by a real apocalypse. Very deep, very esoteric.

Finally, this game also has a very lively online community. One server with no one on. Again the deep emotional connection to a real zombie situation that makes you reflect on how alone you'd be in the real apocalypse. So you can run around on the same maps, with no ammo, being chased by dozens of AI around a small dark map, but now with no one to help you. Amazing!

This game is an Avant garde minimalist esoteric masterpiece.
Solid 9/9 games on greenlight at one time.

reviewText:
Tired of easy zombie games?

Here is the answer to your pleas. The Slaughtering Grounds is an unapologetic first grade zombie slaying simulator.
The main feature of the game is the massive viewmodels that obscure most of the screen. This makes the zombies harder to see and thus increases the difficulty.

Furthermore this Dark Soulsesque game has no indications of damage meaning that you can never take your eyes off the health bar. With three unique characters to play with this game offers countless oppurtunities for replayability.

Let's not forget the best part of the game, there is chance of the Diablo himself to appear and chase you around the map. The knowledge that this massive threat can appear at any given moment leads to a tense and scary feeling persisting thoughout the game.

So in short: a realistic first person viewmodel horror zombie based survival simulator.

reviewText: Until I downloaded the Slaughtering Grounds, I never knew what true beauty was. But after playing this...this cultural epoch..this...this transcedent, god-like masterpiece, I now know what beauty truly is. The graphics are truly to die for, the gameplay is earth-shatteringly unique, and always a challenging experience with the randomized maps. The story is gripping, immersive and the characters are truly likeable and very complex indeed, with detailed backstories, and living relationships with other characters and the zombies, who felt like family to me.  And that was just single player. From the moment I signed into the Slaughtering Block, I realized that this game had a vibrant, active, friendly and incredibly accepting community. Digital Homocide has truly created a timeless masterpiece that will endure as a game long after the cancerous money grubbing crap♥♥♥♥♥s like Bethesda and BioWare have faded into worthless obscurity like they deserve.\n11/10

harry potter and the lord of the dragon lance rings Movie 4: The Slaughtering Grounds

graphics 10/10

reviewText:
Oh BOY this game was absolute garbage.

At the fastest setting, this runs at a staggering 10 fps to where the most beautiful setting runs at 10 as well.  You have one character to choose at the start, and to unlock others you must have money. To get money, you kill zombies. You kill zombies with your gun, and there lies your problem, your gun has limited ammo, and you must find refill pack, which are ALSO limited and DON'T respawn (Unlike games like TF2.). Speaking of respawning, you will often find yourself spawning on TOP OF AN ENEMY. That is just HORRID proggraming. You don't have a great soundtrack either, and the only song is the trailer theme, that beautiful, gross, wet clapping sound. Mmm.


Long story short, don't ever buy this game, even if it is .99 cents. My friend gifted this to me, and I felt immense sympathy for wasting his cash.

Best game ever. Don't understand the hate.

Here is my review.

Story -

10/10

Best story in a game becuase their is none. The developers took a smart move and said, ♥♥♥♥ the story
date:
and added no story to the game. Instead, focused on more important stuff.

Framerate/Graphics/Bugs

10/10

To start out, there are absolutly no bugs in this game. This makes big companies like EA and Ubisoft look pathetic, this game is perfect. Moving onto graphics, this game makes Crysis 3 look like a potato. The graphics and visuals are absolutely stunning, perfect models, animations, textures, you name it. It comes with six very descriptive and well named graphics presets, starting out with

Fastest (For scrubs) Needs a GTX 960 ti
Fast (For potatoes) Needs a GTX 970 ti
Simple (Ehh) Needs a GTX 980 ti
Good (Good) Needs a GTX Titian X
Beautiful (Perfect) Requires GeForce Titan X SuperClock Running in a six way SLI.

Don't forget the framerate, runs perfectly no studdering whatsoever best game.

Gameplay -

10/10

You spawn. You kill zombies. You die. You repeat.

Multiplayer -

10/10

Evryone is so scrubby at the game no one plays it multiplayer if you do invite me i'll rekt you in 1v1

This game is for the person who,

A. Is a connisur of game collects
B. Is me
C. Needs help considering suicide
D. Wants to be apart of gaming history

Also this game is great with VR i got it working i will not tell you how.

Do buy this game.

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds
Three words.
Makes 3.

3 lines make a triangle.
Game involves death.
Death means dismemberment.
Eyes come from bodies
Eyes plus triangles = all seeing eye
Illuminati confirmed

Either way I thank the creator for the 13 seconds of amusement that it gave me. The graphics were spectacular, and the feeling from closing the game truly was a relief. It gives the same experience as a near death expression. Death can bring out an adrenaline surge close to having one's ♥♥♥♥♥ bitten off. It is exciting. And arousing in a morbid sense.
I love it.
Currently I believe I have one of the highest playrates in this household. And so it shall forever be.
Thank you.
I love this game.
Truly. More than I love Jake's ♥♥♥♥♥.

http://ralek-arts.tumblr.com/
Have a tumblr I grabbed from my browsing history of 2010.

This made my day.,
Thank you.
I love you.
<3

reviewText:
I have been playing Tiger Woods '08 PC on a regular basis since it came out back in 2007. No modern game has come close. That is until this game was released.

The graphics are top notch and very realistic. The addition of trees and bushes since last year improved the visuals a great deal. The graphic improvements will no doubt continue in the future with the possible addition of 3D blades of grass using Nvidia’s graphics technology.

Online play is great with turn based multiplayer and the ability to play with up to 8 players. You can stop and resume your round at a later time. There are loads of different play modes available. If tournaments are your thing you can participate in many online. The game also has a cool replay feature that allows you to watch the last round from a number of different angles. Your opponent(s) can see the replays as well.

Another big plus for the game is the freecam mode. Take a virtual tour of the entire game from every conceivable angle and soak in the wonderful immersion that this game provides.

This game has lived up to its potential. Every update over the last year has shown improvement, especially the most recent update from last month. This community driven game will only get better in the months and years to come. Be sure to give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds is another masterpiece from the Digital Homicide Studios.

It's a total mix of fun, satisfaction, and zombie goodness.
It is a beautiful game developed by our one and only Digital Homicide Studios, it is a game where you shoot zombies and the AI is very clever so you will not expect the movement of any zombie.

GRAPHICS:
The stunning 3D cutting-edge graphics just makes it better by perfectly rendering a beautiful looking city in such a spine-chilling atmosphere.

GAMEPLAY:
The controls are top-notch, best controls I have ever felt in a shooting game.
The difficulty is pretty damn brutal, you are left in a city filled to the brim with zombies, the bullets are very limited so you have to use your bullets wisely. There are many random events that happen such asfrenzied zombies, airplane cargo drops, boss spawns and more! You purchase new characters or you can upgrade your existing ones' health, armor, health regeneration, reload rate, damage, the amount of ammo you pick up. This game has so much depth even at such a low price.


SOUND:
The voice acting is just so good, I thought I was listening to Morgan Freeman whispering to me on a peaceful rainy night.
The musical score is just..Oh God.... Just so damn brilliant >.<!!! This is the best music to have EVER been in a game, rumors say that they had Yuzo Koshiro to compose for The Slaughtering Grounds.

OVERALL:
The Slaughtering Grounds is the perfect zombie shooting game you are looking for, stunning graphics, great controls, and great gameplay.
What can I say? This game is a masterpiece.

SCORE: 10/10

reviewText:
There is no game like this one. The Slaughtering Grounds manages to soar far above other titles of its genre and add yet another level of intricate artistic enrichment and dazzling gameplay. I sometimes feel like I shouldn't be allowed to play this game because it is so fun, and should go back to playing other games that get dwarfed in comparison to this one.

When a novel gives me a strong emotional response to its contents, I applaud it for being superior to many others. When a game does this, I know I'm playing The Slaughtering Grounds. Some of the dialogue is the funniest I've ever heard; some of it deeply bothers me and drives me, in true anger and passion, to beat the game and prove myself... to a character in a video game. I actually feel like I am the main character in this game. At the very least, I empathize with them 100%.

And the gameplay... like I said, there is nothing like it. Riding the learning curve of The Slaughtering Grounds and realizing that no, some of the levels really aren't impossible, are incredible experiences. The achievement and satisfaction of solving a difficult and very intellectual 3-D puzzle feels wonderful.

You may have heard people speak well of this game, and I'd like to speak greatly of it. But if all that hasn't convinced you to get it, then maybe this will: it's just fun. It's an FPS with no gun, a purely intellectual flourish of discovery, mystery, immersive gameplay, and, if you stay with it, the greatest victories you can find on Steam. Please get The Slaughtering Grounds (after you get Time Ramesside). Please do it. I would be happy for anyone that decided to pick up and play The Slaughtering Grounds, because I would be absolutly confident that they will have as much fun in it as I did.

reviewText:
In all my days of playing video games, this is by far the best game I've ever played. It might just be the best one ever made. I'll bet money that this game saved the gaming industry much like Super Mario Bros. for the NES. I'm sure you've been caught in the massive crowds of people rushing to their computers shortly after hearing about this game, undoubtedly to purchase such a once in a lifetime deal.

It has the most mature and experienced devs the world has to offer. A simple google search will show you only a hint at what this game is, for the rest of the game is simply too elaborate and mysterious for any one person to discover entirely. You do not understand the beauty of this game until it gives you a default aspect ratio that cuts off the unneeded buttons on the side of the screen like the arrows to change characters and weapons, or my personal favorite button, the EXIT" button.

The best part about this game is the community and devs. Once you think you know everything about this game

reviewText:
The Slaughtering Grounds is a ACTION packed game full of zombies, guns, and shooting the zombies with the guns.  There are obstacles in your way that will make traversing the map dangerous.  Earn cash, buy upgrades to improve your chance against the zombies.

Pros
Game play is solid, like my ♥♥♥♥♥ after I eat taco bell.
Zombies walk at you, then stand there, and your health bar goes down
Guns aim pretty much in the general direction you want them to shoot, and things die
The game gives you aids

Cons
Sometimes, I die, because I wasn't good enough for the game.
Sometimes, I pick up ammo crates on accident, when I jump over them. Kinda a silly bug, don't you think
Friendly players can't see you, but can launch you outside of the map, where you are free to see all the HD textures, collision detection, and buildings that you can't walk in, but look nice.
The Game plays with your brain, making you click 2 to access your first weapon, and 1 to access your second weapon. This played with my brain, but once I got used to the mechanics, it was a breeze to switch weapons
This game DIDN'T give me aids

In Summary, this game is .19 cents, and they could have charged a dollar.

reviewText: the slaughtering grounds is the most ♥♥♥♥ing game I have every played. It turns out that the developer of this masterpiece is the same developer who got drunk and made World of Warcraft in a weekend. The Music by Kevin MacLeod is pure genius and the graphics have such good artistic cohesion its almost as if the developer did not buy random stock unity assets and threw them together using a scattering paint brush tool and then not even write any code he also bought all the scripts and then he took a picture of himself with a giant ♥♥♥♥ in his mouth and then use that as the texture for every single model in the game. I really wish the developer who is very talented would sell this game for $59.99 instead of -$1000. He is under the false impression that this game is bad, but it's really not. It's on the level of quality of Uncrowded, which is literally just one unity asset pack with no modifications. It actually outshines it slightly because this was actually modified. Simply put, it's the best thing on steam right now, and I don't think you should pass this one up\n

reviewText:
Ah yes, The Slaughtering Grounds...
This game was released on Halloween, and it released my sexual fantasies.
In this intense zombie FPS, you are always on the run from the scary zombies and keeping an eye out for ammo, you feel the intensity when the zombies come in swarms and there is no way out.
You can select your character, and upgrade him. Very nice feature.
The game runs on Unity, so your Grandma's PC could probably run this epic, scary and awesome game.
It only cost $1, if you can't buy it or don't want to, are you poor or something?
This game has some rockin' tunes.
I would rate this game 8/10.

reviewText:
Well Well Well, this game is interesting?

The game is good... for the price of 19 cents. When I first got it I started it up and blew it off judging its graphics, UI, and mechanics. It is bad in each of those, but it isn't terrible. Once you get around the curve of understanding what works and what doesn't it can be a decent zombie shooter! The game does a poor job of explaining all the features so I will help with that.

After the time limit ends the level will change to the next. So it is basically survival, there are objectives like kill 10 zombies with headshots etc. I haven't seen a point to these I guess to make the game seem that much less stale.

Every so often the zombies will go into a frenzy mode, which possibly triggers a boss" monster. I say boss lightly because they are no boss at all because they usually just take one shot from the shotgun even though they dwarf small buildings... the kinds of "bosses" that I have ran into are a giant gargoyle
recommended:
and a giant wolf. Each of these monsters drops a huge amount of money that can be easily exploited.

The game has the usual money and ability system where zombie kills get you money and you can spend it on player upgrades and weapons. There is even a multiplayer which I have not yet tried out due to it probably being horribly buggy or not even working at all.

Considering everything and the huge amount of money that I spent on it I would definately recommend this game.

Bottem line
voteText: but it isn't awful either. It still holds the essence of a zombie shooter
helpfulPercent:
but it executes it poorly.


"

reviewText: Honestly, I don't know why people say this is the worst game of all time. I have now stepped up to provide an opinion that is much more true and fair than 72% of other reviews. This is truely the best game I have ever bought on steam. I love hte amazing, breathtaking even, graphical capabilities of this game. I love the sprites and player models, which have such extreme detail. It plays much like CoD zombies, but there is a bigger map, providing for much more exploration. I really love that you can't hear the zombies creep up on you, so there is an actual challenge when you get hurt. I love trailing zombies around the map to find ammo and health. And don't even get me started on the multiplayer. It's an unbelieveable multiplayer experience, especially for one dollar. I've always wanted a multiplayer zombie shooter that could be on par with left 4 dead(and it's sequel) that all my friends can afford(I mean I bought for all my friends). I have put about 18 hours in so far, and am excited to put in 18 hours more. I would rate this at about a 99/100, just behind my DRM-free copy of the witcher 3, time ramesside, and Alpha Zylon.

reviewText: I would consider this one of the best 'hidden gems' I've found in recent memory. Much like finding a copy of Out of This World at a yard sale, I went in without knowing what to expect. What I found was a challenging and sometimes frightening survival game, with unique characters and a fluid soundtrack. This is a true testament to the fact that a game does not have to have a well known developer behind it to succeed at enrapturing the player in it's unique and interesting world.
